title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Responds To Shooting At Bondi Beach Hanukkah Celebration | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has confirmed that the national security committee was convened in response to the Bondi Beach shooting earlier this afternoon.  He described the attack as an act of “evil antisemitism” and said that Australians will come together in response. title: LIVE: Rolling Coverage Of Bondi Beach Shooting Aftermath | 10 News
description: At least 10 people have died in a shooting at Bondi Beach, with another 12 injured. Authorities have confirmed that one of those killed was involved in the attack, while a second suspect is in police custody.

title: Prime Minister Albanese Reacts To Bondi Terrorist Attack | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has delivered a powerful statement in response to the shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney. title: NSW Police Reveal Identity Of Bondi Beach Shooters | 10 News
description: NSW Police have confirmed the identity of the suspected shooters who perpetrated the horrific terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on Sunday.  Police revealed the alleged duo are a father and son. The elder man, a 50-year-old, was shot and killed by police. NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon stated the deceased man was a licensed firearms carrier and had six firearms in his possession.  The younger man remains in a critical condition under police guard in hospital. title: Prime Minister Thanks Bondi Shooting Bystander Hero | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and NSW Premier Chris Minns have thanked first responders and innocent bystanders who acted and "risked their own lives" to save others during the Bondi Beach Shooting on Sunday.  Footage emerged on Sunday night of a man heroically tackling and disarming one of the shooters, with the Prime Minister calling acts such as these "the best of the Australian character".  Watch 10 News for the latest on the Bondi Beach Shootings. title: Netanyahu Accuses Albanese Of Fueling Antisemitism For Sydney Bondi Beach Shooting | 10 News
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has blamed the Australian government’s policies for allegedly letting ‘the disease’ of antisemitism spread in the aftermath of the Bondi Beach Shooting.  Netanyahu said he had written to Albanese, in August, warning that the government’s decision to recognize a Palestinian state “pours fuel on the antisemitic fire… emboldens those who menace Australian Jews and encourages the Jew hatred now stalking your streets.”  US President Donald Trump has also taken a moment to comment on the incident during a Christmas celebration at the White House stating, “That was a terrible attack, 11 dead, 29 badly wounded. And that was an antisemitic attack, obviously.”  Join the conversation and follow us on: Twitter: http://twitter.com/10NewsAU Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/10NewsAU/ Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/10NewsAU/ TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@10NewsAU  10 News airs at 5 pm, seven nights a week in your local market on Network 10.
